summary: This bill, the Protecting Students on Campus Act of 2025, aims to increase awareness of Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, which prohibits discrimination based on race, color, or national origin in programs and activities receiving federal funding. It mandates the Department of Education to conduct a public awareness campaign, requires institutions of higher education to prominently display a link to the Office for Civil Rights webpage and post campaign materials, and mandates congressional briefings, audits, and studies to monitor and address related complaints.
